name: cast
description: A Swiss Army knife for interacting with Ethereum applications from the command line

subcommands.name: cast age
subcommands.description: Get the timestamp of a block

options.description: The color of the log messages

Use the Flashbots RPC URL with fast mode (<https://rpc.flashbots.net/fast>). This shares the transaction privately with all registered builders. See: <https://docs.flashbots.net/flashbots-protect/quick-start#faster-transactions>
Print help (see a summary with '-h')
Allow insecure RPC connections (accept invalid HTTPS certificates). When the provider's inner runtime transport variant is HTTP, this configures the reqwest client to accept invalid certificates.
Format log messages as JSON

JWT Secret for the RPC endpoint. The JWT secret will be used to create a JWT for a RPC. For example, the following can be used to simulate a CL `engine_forkchoiceUpdated` call: cast rpc --jwt-secret <JWT_SECRET> engine_forkchoiceUpdatedV2 '["0x6bb38c26db65749ab6e472080a3d20a2f35776494e72016d1e339593f21c59bc", "0x6bb38c26db65749ab6e472080a3d20a2f35776494e72016d1e339593f21c59bc", "0x6bb38c26db65749ab6e472080a3d20a2f35776494e72016d1e339593f21c59bc"]'
Do not print log messages
Specify custom headers for RPC requests
Timeout for the RPC request in seconds. The specified timeout will be used to override the default timeout for RPC requests.
The RPC endpoint, default value is http://localhost:8545
Number of threads to use. Specifying 0 defaults to the number of logical cores

Verbosity level of the log messages. Pass multiple times to increase the verbosity (e.g. -v, -vv, -vvv). Depending on the context the verbosity levels have different meanings. For example, the verbosity levels of the EVM are: - 2 (-vv): Print logs for all tests. - 3 (-vvv): Print execution traces for failing tests. - 4 (-vvvv): Print execution traces for all tests, and setup traces for failing tests. - 5 (-vvvvv): Print execution and setup traces for all tests, including storage changes.
